page.title: 02ARMED FORCES
page.content:
No airfields are presently in this area, though the concrete control tower of a Second World War ('39-'45) RAF Airfield is between Stackyard Green and Spring Farm House in square one. This was, and is, a flat field and has no indications of runways. There are, however, three RAF airfields in the area and the skies over this area are tracked by high flying large trans-ocean aircraft and fighter aircraft. The fighter aircraft from one airfield take off and make landing approaches over this area, and react to 'intrusions'from USSR aircraft.
hey take-off on re-heat and make very noisy steep ascents turning onto easterly bearings. American Tankbusters practice anti-tank skills by hedge-hopping over these fields.
